definition: social gaffe or blunder/faux pas/see 出洋相[chu1 yang2 xiang4]
ocean/vast/foreign/silver dollar or coin
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to make a fool of oneself

sentences.english: John made a monkey out of himself while trying to make a fool out of Jim.
sentences.chinese: 约翰本想愚弄吉姆，却让自己出了洋相。

sentences.english: She enjoys trying to score off other people.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢想尽办法出别人的洋相。

sentences.english: He cut a poor figure on a public occasion.
sentences.chinese: 他在大庭广众中大出洋相。

sentences.english: You ought ton't do expressions in class.
sentences.chinese: 上课无所不能做鬼脸，出洋相。

sentences.english: He made an embarrassing gaffe at the convention last weekend.
sentences.chinese: 他在上周末的会议上出了洋相，狼狈不堪。

sentences.english: Just went up battlefield, ma Jiang gave " of silly sight of very much " again.
sentences.chinese: 刚上战场，马强又出了很多“洋相”。

sentences.english: When training with the nunchaku at first, be prepared to look like a bad comedy routine.
sentences.chinese: 开始学习双节棍时，要有出洋相的心理准备。

sentences.english: When they make spectacles of themselves.
The master thought the slave made him look like a fool.
sentences.chinese: 主人认为奴隶使他出尽洋相。

sentences.english: They sell like "Bloopers" and sell the "Out Takes".
sentences.chinese: 他们卖这些“不选用镜头”和“洋相镜头”。

sentences.english: I'm afraid my chidren are going to show me up in that luxurious restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我担心我的孩子们在那家豪华的饭店里会出我的洋相。

sentences.english: I don't look silly in public. That's the difference.
sentences.chinese: 我不会在公从面前出洋相，这就是区别。

sentences.english: It’s always fun to see people make fools of themselves.
sentences.chinese: 有人出洋相，总是很好玩的。

sentences.english: Please don't make a scene in public places.
sentences.chinese: 请不要在公共场合大吵大闹出洋相。

sentences.english: It amused him to see people make fools of themselves.
sentences.chinese: 看到人们出洋相把他逗笑了。

sentences.english: You have ton't do expressions in class.
sentences.chinese: 上课不能做鬼脸，出洋相。

definition: to make a fool of oneself
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
rotten idea
to lose face
(coll.) to have sth embarrassing happen
branch road/setback/accident/hiccup
surname Qiu
dry rations (for a journey)/(dialect) (of noodles etc) to become mush (from overcooking)/(coll.) embarrassing/embarrassment
to make a fool of oneself
to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
trouble/blunder
shameful performance/disgraceful situation
dirty trick
basket
to make a fool of oneself
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
